alert.note: Alert for Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 04 at 7:30AM CST until March 05 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central and south central Missouri, including the following counties, in east central Missouri, Phelps. In south central Missouri, Dent, Oregon, Shannon and Texas. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 729 AM CST, The Department of Transportation reported that several low water crossing remain flooded due to runoff from previous heavy rain in the advisory area that occurred Thursday evening into Friday morning. - This includes the following low water crossings... Gladden Creek at County Road 624, Meramec River at Spur Road, Mahans Creek at County Road 501, Big Creek at County Road 390, Warm Fork Spring River at County Road 323, Piney Creek at County Road 228 and Dry Fork Creek at County Road 2430. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salem, Thayer, Winona, Alton, Birch Tree, Eminence, Summersville, Bunker, Koshkonong, Montier, Thomasville, Alley Spring, West Eminence, Round Spring, Teresita, Akers, Midridge, Gladden, Greer, Jadwin, Turtle, Montauk, Darien, Rover, Wilderness, Stone Hill, Couch, Howes, Lenox, Bangert, Myrtle, Sligo, Anutt, Lake Spring, Lecoma, Ozark National Scenic Riverways, Echo Bluff State Park, Current River State Park, Montauk State Park and Grand Gulf State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
